content:
I’m a PhD candidate in economics at Vanderbilt University. I study inter-firm networks and their impact on economic growth through firm productivity and international trade.
Fields of Specialization: Industrial Organization, International Trade, Networks
summary:
I’m a PhD candidate in economics at Vanderbilt University. I study inter-firm networks and their impact on economic growth through firm productivity and international trade.
Fields of Specialization: Industrial Organization, International Trade, Networks
title: Ebehi Iyoha

summary: I propose a procedure to jointly estimate productivity and spillovers.
title: Production Function Estimation in the Presence of Spillovers [JMP]
Firm-level Multilateral Resistance: How important is distance for well-connected firms?

summary: I estimate productivity spillovers from exporters and multinationals to US firms.
title: Spillovers from Exporters and Multinationals through the Network of US Firms
